issue.title: [ENH] FreshPRINCE params moved from _config into estimator

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
This PR moves testing params of `FreshPRINCE` into the estimator, from the `_config` file.

This is useful in itself, as it addresses #1678.

But it may also help us diagnose the CI/CD issue #1941 - @lmmentel suspects `FreshPRINCE` since it hangs for him locally when trying to create a test instance.

issue.title: DRAFT for diagnosing CI/CD: empty set of estimators in test_all_estimators

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body: An attempt at diagnosing #1941: removes all tests in `test_all_estimators`.

issue.title: DRAFT for diagnosing CI/CD: smaller set of class tests test_all_estimators, instance tests all removed

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
An attempt at diagnosing #1941: after removing all tests in `test_all_estimators`, adds back classes individually.

Aim is to conduct a binary search to identify a precise failure condition. I'll determine the number `i` such that adding back `estimator_classes_to_test[0:i]` does not fail but `estimator_classes_to_test[0:i+1]` does

This must exist because the tests run for `estimator_classes_to_test[0:0]` (empty list, #1946) but fail for `estimator_classes_to_test` (situation on main, and #1946 in earlier stage where only instance tests were removed), for a total of 135 estimator classes in `sktime` currently.

issue.title: [ENH] verbose CI/CD test for mac and unix

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
In our current GitHub actions CI/CD, the windows tests are verbose, i.e., logs per test are printed out, which is very useful for diagnosing on remote.

This is not the case for mac and unix (only "dots" are printed and percentages) - it would be great if it were.

Not sure what would have to be changed, but perhaps a good first issue for someone with CI/CD and/or GitHub actions experience.

issue.title: DRAFT for diagnosing CI/CD: Revert recent numba/cython related changes

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body: This reverts last 2 days' work on numba/cython issues, to diagnose #1941.

issue.title: DRAFT for diagnosing CI/CD: removal of tests from `test_all_estimators`

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
An attempt at diagnosing #1941.

This PR removes individual tests from `test_all_estimators`:

* `test_multiprocessing_idempotent`, this could lead to freezes due to parallelization/virtualization issues
* `test_methods_have_no_side_effects`, this could lead to an infinite loop in `deep_equals` if an estimator contains an infinitely looping dict of dict where some pointer accident has happened

issue.title: Temporary fix for CI/CD: removal of `test_multiprocessing_idempotent`

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
An attempt at diagnosing #1941.

This PR removes a single individual test from `test_all_estimators`: `test_multiprocessing_idempotent`.
See also #1952.

Apparently, this renders the remote tests working again. Suggest this PR as a temporary fix.

issue.title: [MNT] Remove `pytest-xdist` from CI-CD, un-skip `test_multiprocessing_idempotent`

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
Update: upgrading this from a draft.

This PR removes `pytest-xdist` from CI-CD and adds back `test_multiprocessing_idempotent`.

This is based on the observation/conclusion that `pytest-xdist` is causing multiple strange interactions which lead to crashes and erroring out of our CI-CD under hard to specify conditions.

Implements https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/2012 (also see there for further details)

---
Draft, attempt at diagnosing #1941 - removing `pytest-xdist`.

Also adds back `test_multiprocessing_idempotent` to see what happens.

issue.title: [MNT] removing `pytest-xdist` from CI/CD?

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
It would seem that `pytest-xdist` is behind:
* the so far undiagnosed, major CI/CD issue https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/1941 which caused us so much trouble after the CI/CD refactor, and days of work just to track down the test which it interacted with. See https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/2004
* a newly emergent issue of random worker crashes after an innocuous move to testing classes, in https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/1992. See #1999 and https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/2003
* issues that I face in local testing on my windows machine - after a number of runs, vs code crashes; also, it creates a number of stray processes which eat memory and have to be killed manually

This indicates to me that `pytest-xdist` is still a bit immature, and at risk of causing unexplainable, hard to diagnose CI/CD issues. Do we really know when it strikes next, or how corretness of the tests is impacted?

I do think, hence, that we should remove it from our CI/CD set-up.
The cost is, roughly, a doubling of CI/CD time, since the current set-up uses test parallelization with 2 workers.

FYI @lmmentel.

body: The issue and precise condition seems to be coming from `pytest-xdist`, see here for further diagnosis: https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/2004

issue.title: Hard-to-diagnose failures in sktime CI/CD

repository.name: pytest-xdist
repository.description: pytest plugin for distributed testing and loop-on-failures testing modes.

issue.body:
First of all, really great package! Excellent to speed up testing and/or distribute it.

I wanted to report some hard-to-diagnose issues on `sktime` (AI for time series package)
https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime
that ultimately made us remove it from the CI/CD.
Summary here:
https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/2012

The individual problems in the remote CI/CD are as follows:
* in combination with a test that tests parallelization of algorithm, it would lead to *stochastic* (not deterministic) hangs of individual workers. Problem described here: https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/1941
Precise condition and stochastic behaviour identified here: https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/1949
* stochastic worker crahses when using `pytest` test classes vs not, the precise condition is presence of the same tests in those classes, as opposed to functions. Problem described here: https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/1992

I know this may be hard to track down, but it seems to touch very general useability of `pytest-xdist`.
Happy to help in further identifying the problems, since we really would like to use `pytest-xdist`.

issue.title: [MNT] Remove `pytest-xdist` from mac&linux CI-CD, un-skip `test_multiprocessing_idempotent`

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
This PR:
* removes `pytest-xdist` from macos & linux CI/CD 
* makes macos & linux CI/CD conditional on windows CI/CD
* adds back `test_multiprocessing_idempotent`.

Alternative version of #2004 which ensures "fail fast" through windows CI/CD which still uses `pytest-xdist`.

Implements https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/2012 (also see there for further details)

issue.title: [ENH] test framework: test classes, generators for fixture lists, pytest-xdist enabled

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
See here for overview of recent test framework related PRs:
https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/2053

This seems to be the fastest combination of conditions, and one where the tests pass!

---

Version of #1992 with generators rather than lists being returned by the `generator_dict`, and `pytest-xdist` added back.
Equivalently, a version of #2022 with `pytest-xdist` added back.

This is to diagnose whether #2022 - which seems to have solved a major memory bottleneck - will now work with `pytest-xdist` 
That is, except for the known bug with `test_multiprocessing_idempotent` #1941; a skip for the test is also introduced in this PR.

issue.title: [ENH] memory profiling of pytest on CI/CD

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
I think we should do memory profiling on pytest in our CI/CD.
See discussion in https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/2012 why I suspect this may be helpful to diagnose problems and validate hypotheses on our CI/CD failures.

I attached "good first issue", since this may be easy for someone who knows how to do this already (while it may be difficult for someone who doesn't, such as myself).

body:
Local testing under Ubuntu 20 WSL suggests the following:

1. Main culprit is some hard to identify interaction between pytest-xdist (with n>1, e.g. n=2), pytest-cov and joblib. What is clear, this is not memory leak, or some other excessive resource usage, it appears to be "deadlock". 

Rest of commentary focused on the:
[`sktime/tests/test_all_estimators.py::TestAllEstimators::test_multiprocessing_idempotent`
](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/be65769f1c7e5536d77025ca91d008f5b1a7177b/sktime/tests/test_all_estimators.py#L975)

Which is currently skipped but was un-skipped for testing.

Hang ups stop if:
- `-n 2` is dropped in the invocation of pytest which is equivalent to "no xdist"
- or `--cov=sktime` is dropped so no coverage report
- or -k "not fresh" which is equivalent to dropping all of the test variants of `{TSFreshClassifier TSFreshFeatureExtractor FreshPRINCE} `

3. Observation (htop with python filter) suggests that at some point when tests hit one of the "fresh" as above (with `--cov=sktime` and `-n 2`) all CPU activity stops -> deadlock. 
 - Sometimes after hours (3+h) of waiting it snaps out, but for most tests I didn't wait beyond ~5 min.
 - Related issue here in [pytest-cov](https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest-cov/issues/492)

5. For now practical change will be to separate
- `test_all_estimators.py::TestAllEstimators::test_multiprocessing_idempotent` out and test it independent of all the other tests with xdist disabled = remove `-n 2`. 
- rest of the tests can be done with xdist on `-n=2` e.g. with `-k "not test_multiprocessing_idempotent".  Which means mostly changes to the [Makefile](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/41a5ae9c70a3fafba89304d8025b969a84de818a/Makefile#L31)

e.g. below snippet 
 - line 1 `test_multiprocessing_idempotent` only with**out** coverage and xdist
 - line 2 without `test_multiprocessing_idempotent` with coverage and xdist
```
cd ${TEST_DIR}; python -m pytest -v --showlocals --durations=20 --pyargs $(PACKAGE) -k "test_multiprocessing_idempotent"
cd ${TEST_DIR}; python -m pytest --cov-report html --cov=sktime -v -n 2 --showlocals --durations=20 --pyargs $(PACKAGE) -k "not test_multiprocessing_idempotent"
```

This misses the coverage report for `test_multiprocessing_idempotent` but at least we are testing it :)
- Skipping xdist for `test_multiprocessing_idempotent` makes sense anyway since it's using joblib internally so does what xdist is meant to do.
- Skipping coverage for `test_multiprocessing_idempotent` till we figure out why there is problem.

7. Suggestion is at some point investigate deeper why exactly this happens...

PR coming up shortly...

issue.title: [BUG] Split pytest multiprocessing addressing #1941

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
#### Reference Issues/PRs
Fixes #1941 sort of.
Un-skip [test_multiprocessing_idempotent](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/d8e478d2d654c7fdf2f782cf0e91370c9fb3d865/sktime/tests/test_all_estimators.py#L975)
Split testing test_multiprocessing_idempotent into a separate [pytest invocation](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/1941#issuecomment-1069139883).

#### What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes.
- In [test_multiprocessing_idempotent](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/d8e478d2d654c7fdf2f782cf0e91370c9fb3d865/sktime/tests/test_all_estimators.py#L975)
Removed:
```python
# todo: this needs to be diagnosed and fixed - temporary skip
@pytest.mark.skip(reason="hangs on mac and unix remote tests")
```
- In [Makefile](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/d8e478d2d654c7fdf2f782cf0e91370c9fb3d865/Makefile#L31)
Split `pytest` invocation into 2 lines
```
cd ${TEST_DIR}; python -m pytest -v --showlocals --durations=20 --pyargs $(PACKAGE) -k "test_multiprocessing_idempotent"
cd ${TEST_DIR}; python -m pytest --cov-report html --cov=sktime -v -n 2 --showlocals --durations=20 --pyargs $(PACKAGE) -k "not test_multiprocessing_idempotent"
```

 - line 1 `test_multiprocessing_idempotent` only with**out** coverage and xdist
 - line 2 without `test_multiprocessing_idempotent` with coverage and xdist

Tests are not skipped and we still get benefits of xdist. 
For now no coverage from test_multiprocessing_idempotent.

#### Does your contribution introduce a new dependency? If yes, which one?

None

#### What should a reviewer concentrate their feedback on?
Test Coverage advice, perhaps merge html results? 

#### PR checklist

##### For all contributions
- [x] I have not added tests but checked all pass.
